poem:
"Between Headlines"

In the morning paper's fragile gown,
declares a war with no victors crowned,
In that never-restless Middle East,
a play of drones and missiles unleashed.
Yet, my coffee does not tremble in its cup,
as also Israel in steadfastness stands up,
While Iran's rancor in the morning glow,
is cooled by US affirmations silent snow.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "White House reaffirms Israel backing but says ‘we don’t seek war with Iran’ US officials on Sunday sought to strike a delicate balance with Israel after the key US ally was attacked by Iran on Saturday, staunchly affirming their alliance with the Israelis while also making it clear the US will not support further military action. Iran launched the air assault with drones and missiles after Israel attacked an Iran diplomatic facility in Syria, killing". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: White House reaffirms Israel backing but says ‘we don’t seek war with Iran’ US officials on Sunday sought to strike a delicate balance with Israel after the key US ally was attacked by Iran on Saturday, staunchly affirming their alliance with the Israelis while also making it clear the US will not support further military action.
